content.description: The crack is fingers to small hands in the bottom, then ascend easy, laid-back climbing to the topout. Make a natural anchor.
content.protection: A singles rack. A natural anchor can be built on the top.
content.location: It ascends the obvious, good-looking finger crack in the middle of the wall, just to the right of 3 slab climbs.

content.description: Climb, then mount the separated Stegosaurus flake before reaching the first bolt. You have an option to sling the horn with an alpine sling before standing on it to clip the high first bolt. Figure out how to mount the bulge, clip the 2nd bolt (with an alpine), traverse to the right, and finish the route on the small, right-facing corner. Clip the anchor to the right after grabbing the top of the cliff.
content.location: Start on the left side of the obvious flake separated from the wall. This route breaks off right from the leftmost climb.

climbs.name: Five Niner c/d Plus Minus PG-13 R X

content.description: This route has fun and interesting climbing. Start in the jumbly crack, and move up to good hands. Place a couple pieces, then pop up to the horizontal break. Climb the obvious features straight up to the anchor.
content.protection: One or two hand-sized pieces, #.075, and two bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: Start in the good looking hand to off fingers crack on the middle right side of the cliff.

content.description:
Climb through the middle of the obvious roof. Interesting slab moves get you into an awkward position under the roof. Traverse right to the holds by the lip, then figure out your sequence for pulling over the lip. Delicate face moves get you to another small roof with easy climbing to the top.

Right now, there's only one bolt at the top, but it's easily accessed from the top, and there are plenty of places to add hand-size cams to make an anchor.

Note: it is best not to clip the bolt in the roof (bolt 4) until you're halfway through the traverse. I put the bolt in 100% the wrong spot, but once you clip it before making the move to the lip, you're glad it's there.

This granite had a ton of flaky rock on it that I've tried to clean off, but stuff will keep breaking until it gets climbed a bit. I'd probably give it another star if it weren't for the crumbly patina.
content.protection: 8 bolts + 1 hand-sized cam to complete the anchor.
content.location:
It is in the middle of the obvious roof left of

Brontosaurus is Back

.

content.description: The crux is right off the ground. It is balancy and slopey. Then it is cruiser after the 2nd bolt.
content.location: It is the route to the right of the arete.
